qas.question: How many fans were in attendance during Everton's match against Liverpool on September 18, 1948?
How many fans were injured in Everton's 1948 match against Liverpool that drew the largest crowd they've had?
Who was injured during Everton's record attendance match against Liverpool in 1948?
How many people does Goodison Park stadium hold?
How much did Everton FC pay to transfer Belgian forward Romelu Lukaku?
What's the smallest attendance ever for an Everton home match against Liverpool?
In what year was the Taylor Report recommendations implemented?
What was Romelu Lukaku's highest pay for one season?
How much did it cost to build Goodison Park?
In what year was Goodison Park built?

context: The record attendance for an Everton home match is <a0_0><b5_0>78,299<b5_0/><a0_0/> against Liverpool on 18 September <b6_0><b9_0>1948<b9_0/><b6_0/>. Amazingly, there was only <a1_0>1<a1_0/> injury at this game-<a2_0>Tom Fleetwood<a2_0/> was hit on the head by a coin thrown from the crowd whilst he marched around the perimeter with St Edward's Orphanage Band, playing the cornet. Goodison Park, like all major English football grounds since the recommendations of the Taylor Report were implemented, is now an all-seater and only holds just <a3_0>under 40,000<a3_0/>, meaning it is unlikely that this attendance record will ever be broken at Goodison. Everton's record transfer paid was to Chelsea for Belgian forward Romelu Lukaku for a sum of <a4_0><b7_0><b8_0>£28m<b8_0/><b7_0/><a4_0/>. Everton bought the player after he played the previous year with the team on loan.
